summary: Table CSV file is used for importing and exporting table metadata from and to an **existing** table.

headers.name: name
headers.description: The name of the table being updated.

headers.name: displayName
headers.description: Display name for the table.

headers.name: description
headers.description: Description for the table in Markdown format.
examples: `Customer Schema` that contains all the tables related to customer entity.

headers.name: owner
headers.description: Owner names separated by ';'. For team owner, include prefix team. For user owner, include prefix user.

headers.name: tags
headers.description: Fully qualified classification tag names associated with the table separated by ';'.. These tags are automatically applied along with the glossary term, when it is used to label an entity.

headers.name: glossaryTerms
headers.description: Fully qualified glossary term names associated with the table separated by ';'.. These tags are automatically applied along with the glossary term, when it is used to label an entity.

headers.name: tiers
headers.description: Fully qualified tier tags names associated with the table separated by ';'.

headers.name: retentionPeriod
headers.description: Retention period of the data in the table. Period is expressed as duration in ISO 8601 format in UTC. Example - `P23DT23H`. When not set, the retention period is inherited from the parent database schema, if it exists.

headers.name: sourceUrl
headers.description: Source URL for the table.

headers.name: domain
headers.description: Domain to which the table belongs to.

headers.name: extension
headers.description: Custom property values added to the table. Each field value (property and its value) is separated by `;` and internal values can be separated by `|`. For `entityReferenceList` type property, pass `type1:fqn1|type2:fqn2`. For single `entityReference` type property, pass `type:fqn`. Similarly, for `enumMultiSelect`, pass values separated by `|`, and for `enumSingleSelect`, pass a single value along with the property name. For `timeInterval` property type, pass the `startTime:endTime` to the property name. If the field value itself contains delimiter values like `,` and `;` or newline they need to be quoted, and the quotation needs to be further escaped. In general, if passing multiple field values separated by `;`, the extension column value needs to be quoted.
examples: `"""queryCp:select col,row from table where id ='30';""";stringcp:sample string content"`

headers.name: column.fullyQualifiedName
headers.description: Fully qualified name of the column.

headers.name: column.displayName
headers.description: Display name of the column.

headers.name: column.description
headers.description: Description for the column in Markdown format.
examples: `user_id` column is the primary key and contains unique user ID.

headers.name: column.dataTypeDisplay
headers.description: Display name used for dataType. This is useful for complex types, such as `array<int>`, `map<int,string>`, `struct<>`, and union types.

headers.name: column.dataType
headers.description: Actual Column data type.

headers.name: column.arrayDataType
headers.description: In case of data Type being Array, type of Array Data.

headers.name: column.dataLength
headers.description: Data Length of Column in case of CHAR, VARCHAR, BINARY etc.

headers.name: column.tags
headers.description: Fully qualified classification tag names associated with the column separated by ';'.. These tags are automatically applied along with the glossary term, when it is used to label an entity.

headers.name: column.glossaryTerms
headers.description: Fully qualified glossary term names associated with the column separated by ';'.. Tags automatically derived along with some glossaryTerm will be in `tags`.
